c:

q: Which dplyr function filters rows?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:3, b=4:6)
df %>% select(a) %>% ncol()

q: Match the dplyr functions:
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(3,1,2))
df %>% arrange(a) %>% head(1) %>% pull(a)

q: The ______ operator pipes data in dplyr.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:3)
df %>% mutate(b = a * 2) %>% sum(.$b)

q: Which dplyr function creates new columns?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(g=c('a','a','b'), v=1:3)
df %>% group_by(g) %>% summarise(s=sum(v)) %>% nrow()

q: The summarise function reduces groups to single values.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(3,1,2))
df %>% arrange(desc(a)) %>% first() %>% pull(a)

q: Which function sorts in descending order?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:5)
df %>% slice(2:4) %>% nrow()

q: Match the dplyr summarise functions:
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(1,1,2,2))
df %>% distinct(a) %>% nrow()

q: The ______ function renames columns.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:3)
df %>% rename(x = a) %>% colnames()

q: Which function combines data frames vertically?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df1 <- data.frame(a=1:2)
df2 <- data.frame(a=3:4)
bind_rows(df1, df2) %>% nrow()

q: bind_cols combines data frames horizontally.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:3, b=4:6)
df %>% pull(b) %>% sum()

q: Which function extracts a column as vector?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(NA, 2, 3))
df %>% filter(!is.na(a)) %>% nrow()

q: Match the dplyr join types:
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df1 <- data.frame(k=1:2, a=c('x','y'))
df2 <- data.frame(k=2:3, b=c('p','q'))
inner_join(df1, df2, by='k') %>% nrow()

q: The ______ function counts observations by group.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(g=c('a','a','b'))
df %>% count(g) %>% nrow()

q: Which function drops NA values?
What is the output of this code?

df <- data.frame(a=c(1,NA,3))
df %>% drop_na() %>% nrow()

q: Rearrange the dplyr data analysis workflow:
What is the output of this code?
c:

df <- data.frame(a=1:5)
df %>% filter(between(a, 2, 4)) %>% nrow()

q: Match the tidyr functions:
What is the output of this code?
c:

df <- data.frame(a=1:3)
df %>% transmute(b = a * 2) %>% colnames()

q: Which function modifies and keeps only new columns?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(1,2,3,4,5))
df %>% slice_head(n=2) %>% pull(a) %>% sum()

q: The ______ function gets top n rows.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(1,2,3,4,5))
df %>% slice_tail(n=2) %>% pull(a) %>% sum()

q: across() applies functions to multiple columns.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:3, b=4:6)
df %>% summarise(across(everything(), sum))

q: Match the dplyr selection helpers:
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a_x=1, b_x=2, c_y=3)
df %>% select(ends_with('x')) %>% ncol()

q: Which function calculates row-wise operations?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=1:2, b=3:4)
df %>% rowwise() %>% mutate(s = sum(a, b)) %>% ungroup() %>% pull(s)

q: The ______ function removes grouping.
What is the output of this code?

library(dplyr)
df <- data.frame(a=c(5,3,1,4,2))
df %>% slice_min(a, n=2) %>% pull(a)

q: Which function gets rows with minimum values?
What is the output of this code?

df <- data.frame(a=c(5,3,1,4,2))
df %>% slice_max(a, n=2) %>% pull(a)

q: The ______ function maps data to visual properties in ggplot2.

ggplot(data.frame(x=c('a','b','c'), y=1:3), aes(x, y)) + geom_bar(stat='identity')

q: Match the ggplot2 geoms:
What is the output of this code?

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(g=c('a','b'), y=c(10,20)), aes(g, y)) + geom_col()

q: The ______ function adds titles to ggplot.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
p <- ggplot(data.frame(x=1:3, y=4:6), aes(x, y))
p + geom_point() + labs(title='My Plot')

q: Which function adds axis labels?
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=1:10, g=rep(c('a','b'),5)), aes(x, fill=g)) + geom_histogram()

q: facet_wrap creates small multiples in ggplot2.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=1:6, y=1:6, g=rep(c('a','b'),3)), aes(x,y)) + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~g)

q: Match the ggplot2 theme elements:
What is the output of this code?

ggplot(data.frame(x=1:3, y=4:6), aes(x, y)) + geom_point() + theme_minimal()

q: Which function saves a ggplot?
What is the output of this code?

ggplot(data.frame(x=1:5, y=1:5), aes(x, y)) + geom_point(color='red', size=3)

q: The ______ aesthetic maps color to a variable.

q: Which function controls x-axis limits?

q: Which function flips x and y axes?

q: geom_smooth adds trend lines.
What is the output of this code?

q: Match the ggplot2 position adjustments:
What is the output of this code?

df <- data.frame(x=rep(c('a','b'),each=2), y=1:4, g=rep(c('p','q'),2))
ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill=g)) + geom_bar(stat='identity', position='dodge')

q: Which function adds annotations?
What is the output of this code?

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=1:5, y=1:5), aes(x, y)) + geom_point() + annotate('text', x=3, y=3, label='Center')

q: The ______ function controls legend position.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=1:3, y=1:3, g=c('a','b','c')), aes(x, y, color=g)) + geom_point() + theme(legend.position='bottom')

q: facet_grid creates a matrix of panels.
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
df <- data.frame(x=1:8, y=1:8, r=rep(c('r1','r2'),4), c=rep(c('c1','c2'),each=4))
ggplot(df, aes(x,y)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(r~c)

q: Match the ggplot2 coordinate systems:
What is the output of this code?
c:
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=c('a','b','c'), y=c(30,50,20)), aes(x='', y=y, fill=x)) + geom_bar(stat='identity') + coord_polar('y')

q: Which function creates violin plots?

What is the output of this code?
Rearrange R data analysis workflow:
What is the output of this code?

ggplot(data.frame(x=1:20, y=1:20), aes(x, y)) + geom_point() + geom_hline(yintercept=10)
o: Points with horizontal line at y=10

q: Match the ggplot2 stat functions:
What is the output of this code?
